grade_comment:
Grade: 95

Comment: The response provides a comprehensive examination of the transition from temporary to permanent atonement in biblical history, effectively comparing the Old Testament sacrificial system to the New Testament fulfillment in Christ. It clearly explains how the temporary nature of atonement in the Old Testament, through animal sacrifices and rituals, foreshadowed the permanent, once-and-for-all atonement achieved through Jesus' sacrificial death. The integration of biblical references and theological concepts supports the evaluation of atonement's progression from temporary to permanent in an insightful and coherent manner. Overall, this response demonstrates a deep understanding of the topic within a Christian worldview.
